text.#text:
Under the terms of
			 Resolution 2043 of April 21, 2012, the United Nations Security Council
			 established a United Nations Supervision Mission in Syria (UNSMIS), for an
			 initial period of 90 days, under the command of a Chief Military Observer,
			 comprising an initial deployment of up to 300 unarmed military observers as
			 well as an appropriate civilian component to fulfill the following mandate: To
			 monitor a cessation of armed violence in all its forms by all parties and to
			 monitor and support the full implementation of the UNSMIS’ six-point plan.

On June 15, 2012,
			 UNSMIS suspended its activities owing to an intensification of armed violence
			 across the country.
